snippet.textDisplay: Ooh! Fun fact about Scar's name! Taka is actually Scar's first name, mentioned in The Lion King: Six New Adventures. Taka means garbage and Mufasa means king. He tricked a buffo to attack Mufasa, but the buffalo, and his herd, attacked him instead after being laughed at. After getting the scar, Taka preferred to be called a wound instead of garbage. He even told his dad (who saved him) to call him Scar, and that he wouldn't forget what happened to him.
snippet.textOriginal: Ooh! Fun fact about Scar's name! Taka is actually Scar's first name, mentioned in The Lion King: Six New Adventures. Taka means garbage and Mufasa means king. He tricked a buffo to attack Mufasa, but the buffalo, and his herd, attacked him instead after being laughed at. After getting the scar, Taka preferred to be called a wound instead of garbage. He even told his dad (who saved him) to call him Scar, and that he wouldn't forget what happened to him.

snippet.textDisplay:
Also the hyenas don't even laugh in this one; which is confusing since real-life hyenas do in fact laugh. Has Disney forgotten that little animal fact? Disappointing...
Also also you know what could have been interesting? Sure it would have changed some of the original story, but at least it would give us something new rather than just the same exact thing all over again. What if in this version, Scar after killing Mufasa ends up becoming a pretty good king? As in he is actually good at ruling and as a result, the carnivores don't run out of food and there is no drought? And not only is Scar a good king in this what-if version, but ends up being an even better king than Mufasa? Wonder how things would go down differently in this alternative version? Perhaps since this Scar is actually a competent and just ruler the lionesses would be reluctant to attack him? Just something to think about I guess.
snippet.textOriginal:
Also the hyenas don't even laugh in this one; which is confusing since real-life hyenas do in fact laugh. Has Disney forgotten that little animal fact? Disappointing...
Also also you know what could have been interesting? Sure it would have changed some of the original story, but at least it would give us something new rather than just the same exact thing all over again. What if in this version, Scar after killing Mufasa ends up becoming a pretty good king? As in he is actually good at ruling and as a result, the carnivores don't run out of food and there is no drought? And not only is Scar a good king in this what-if version, but ends up being an even better king than Mufasa? Wonder how things would go down differently in this alternative version? Perhaps since this Scar is actually a competent and just ruler the lionesses would be reluctant to attack him? Just something to think about I guess.

snippet.textDisplay:
One thing on both versions does not make sense to me... When Scar was King, after Simba ran away, where was Scars son? Where is the son's mother? You would think both would be a part of the pride when Scar was King... But they never existed in either version. Okay so Lion King 2: Simba's Pride.. Suddenly Scar has a son and ex lover ... Again, never mentioned or part of the pride while Scar ruled. And Scar's son and sons mother say Simba killed Scar, when in fact the hyenas killed Scar at the end of the first Lion King.

Maybe I am looking to deep into it but whatever so is this video..
snippet.textOriginal:
One thing on both versions does not make sense to me...  When Scar was King, after Simba ran away, where was Scars son? Where is the son's mother? Again, never mentioned or part of the pride while Scar ruled. And Scar's son and sons mother say Simba killed Scar, when in fact the hyenas killed Scar at the end of the first Lion King.

snippet.textDisplay:
8:00 so scar got his nickname in childhood. I'm basing this off of memory so some details are wrong, but I believe he attempted to kill mufasa, it backfired, and mufasa saved his ass. The only injury was the scar over scar's face.
You wanna know the real fucked up part? Scar's real name is Taka. Taka means "dirt" "trash" or "want".
snippet.textOriginal:
8:00 so scar got his nickname in childhood. I'm basing this off of memory so some details are wrong, but I believe he attempted to kill mufasa, it backfired,  and mufasa saved his ass.  The only injury was the scar over scar's face. 
You wanna know the real fucked up part?  Scar's real name is Taka. Taka means "dirt" "trash" or "want".

snippet.textDisplay: 7:53 The basic lion King fan lore is that Scar was named Taka, and received an injury giving him a scar. Being the younger sibling to Mufasa, and therefore not the king, the other lions made fun of him and called him scar. One day scar had enough and decided he might as well be addressed as scar, because fuck everyone in the pride:

snippet.textDisplay: I didn't watch the movie, but seeing how lifeless the lions look in these shots makes me glad I didn't. Walt Disney often told his animators to exaggerate a character's actions or emotions so that we, the audience, can actually feel what's happening. In trying to be realistic, they stripped the entirety of the Disney magic. That alone is worth a hundred extra sins.
snippet.textOriginal: I didn't watch the movie, but seeing how lifeless the lions look in these shots makes me glad I didn't. Walt Disney often told his animators to exaggerate a character's actions or emotions so that we, the audience, can actually feel what's happening. In trying to be realistic, they stripped the entirety of the Disney magic. That alone is worth a hundred extra sins.

snippet.textDisplay:
I just want it to be Known for no real reason other than I just fucking got knocked the hell back by it.....That the line, "This Movie Exists" was EXACTLY What I thought at the EXACT moment it was said. Like....DAMN.....That has NEVER Happened to me while watching these Cinima Sins Videos....And that says a hell of alot about how tragically bad this movie was/is and will forever be.

Honestly, If Disney wanted to do THIS Life-Like CGI Style....They should of done Bambi. THAT Would have gone over FAR Better than THIS. For one Deer have Very Big VERY Expressive eyes and cute faces that can be easily given subtle expressions even with a more natural look, MUCH like how the looks work so well on Timon. His big eyes and cute muzzle make for a much better canvas to turn a realistic face into an expression than that of the Lions, Hyenas, Rafiki or Pumba. Disney needs to stop trying to be money hogs and actually THINK about things instead of just saying "OH The Lion King Was One Of Our BEST Selling Movies And STILL Is A Big Hit With Kids Today, Lets Make It Live Action And Get MORE Money!" They should of really considered the story and how well, or in this case how Badly the Emotions that made the origional a hit, would be displayed here. Not to mention the fact that Lion fights and Hyena foghts are VIOLENT AND SCARY To Small Kids. And who do they think would be wanting to watch a DISNEY movie? I mean yeah NOW they own Star Wars and fucking everything else, BUT Lion King 100% was always for KIDS. THIS is not something smaller kids can enjoy like with the original.

And dont get me wrong, Im all for live action things, but people really need to consider if doing the live action will really come off and capture the emotion and vibrancy that made the animated version so good. And Im not even gonna get into the lack of passion and feeling between the voice actors of Simba and Nala. Like there is ZERO passion or love while they are "Singing" together. It doesnt even sound like they were in the same studio in the same room together to even bounce emotion back and forth from each other. Its dull and far more lifeless than the originals that is stirring and makes you FEEL their Love for each other. Its just....The saddest thing to happen to "life-like" cgi movie since DBZ and Speed Racer.

Furthermore, People in Holiwood really need to branch out more and get some fresh blood in the studios and stop always trying to use well known people in movies. Because while sometimes it works, in cases like THIS it fails miserably. Here we can see where having a bunch of well known big name people Did Not make for a good movie. And some fresh faces and voices would have been Awesome for this movie because they could have bonded together better and more emotion would have come through in thwir tones. But credit where its dues, Timon and Pumbaa stole the show. You can hear they are having fun IN their role, not just reading lines. And while Mufasa sounded alittle tired I still Loved that it WAS Mufasa. IDK WTF They Were Thinking When They Cast Scars Voice With Anyone Else BUT Scars Voice.

Ive heard so many people try to say Im shot cause I dont like this movie cause its awesome looking and cool and all the rest of the BS. The fact is Pretty Visuals aint the only thing that makes a movie good. Casting the right voices, making sure the people carry emotion into their performance, good expressio s to show the moods, ALL These things matter just as much as Visuals and quite frankly this movie fell pathetically flat when it came to consistency on all the other points. Its a BEAUTIFULLY Made Movie Visually....Its just a shame they didnt put that same effort into the rest of it.
